segment.source: You can typically go back into Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) projects, edit and redeploy them over and over again.
segment.target: You can typically go back into Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) projects, edit and redeploy them over and over again.

segment.source: Lab 1c: Modify an existing Windows ICD project
segment.target: Lab 1c: Modify an existing Windows ICD project

segment.source: Lab 1c: Modify an existing Windows ICD project
segment.target: Lab 1c: Modify an existing Windows ICD project

segment.source: You can typically go back into Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) projects, edit and redeploy them over and over again.
segment.target: You can typically go back into Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) projects, edit and redeploy them over and over again.

segment.source: Note Copy any new source files, like the provisioning packages, back to the technician PC before starting.
segment.target: Note Copy any new source files, like the provisioning packages, back to the technician PC before starting.

segment.source: This reduces the risk of interrupting the build process from a temporary network issue or from disconnecting the USB device.
segment.target: This reduces the risk of interrupting the build process from a temporary network issue or from disconnecting the USB device.

segment.source: Change the edition (for example, from Core to Pro)
segment.target: Change the edition (for example, from Core to Pro)

segment.source: Export your Windows ICD project into a provisioning package.
segment.target: Export your Windows ICD project into a provisioning package.

segment.source: You can then create a new project in Windows ICD using this provisioning package to quickly build a new image on a different edition.
segment.target: You can then create a new project in Windows ICD using this provisioning package to quickly build a new image on a different edition.

segment.source: To use more than one provisioning package:
segment.target: To use more than one provisioning package:

segment.source: Use the ICD.exe command to combine the provisioning packages.
segment.target: Use the ICD.exe command to combine the provisioning packages.

segment.source: Where /ImageIndex is the index of the Windows image you want to use.
segment.target: Where /ImageIndex is the index of the Windows image you want to use.

segment.source: Note which Windows image to use.
segment.target: Note which Windows image to use.

segment.source: The Client SKU install.wim file includes two different images:
segment.target: The Client SKU install.wim file includes two different images:

segment.source: Index 1 is Windows 10 Professional
segment.target: Index 1 is Windows 10 Professional

segment.source: Index 2 is Windows 10 Core
segment.target: Index 2 is Windows 10 Core

segment.source: Create a deployment configuration file
segment.target: Create a deployment configuration file

segment.source: The ICD.exe command requires a deployment configuration XML file.
segment.target: The ICD.exe command requires a deployment configuration XML file.

segment.source: When you use the WICD UI, this file is created for you.
segment.target: When you use the WICD UI, this file is created for you.

segment.source: When using the ICD command-line, you must create it and specify it as the DeploymentConfigXml parameter in the command.
segment.target: When using the ICD command-line, you must create it and specify it as the DeploymentConfigXml parameter in the command.

segment.source: Here’s a sample that you can use for this lab:
segment.target: Here’s a sample that you can use for this lab:

segment.source: Windows ICD will create the project in the path you select.
segment.target: Windows ICD will create the project in the path you select.

segment.source: You can then copy this data to a USB key and load the image on a new PC.
segment.target: You can then copy this data to a USB key and load the image on a new PC.

segment.source: Create a blank customizations file
segment.target: Create a blank customizations file

segment.source: For this build of Windows 10, you must specify a customizations file by using the CustomizationXML parameter.
segment.target: For this build of Windows 10, you must specify a customizations file by using the CustomizationXML parameter.

segment.source: The provisioning package should contain all of your customizations so we’ll create a blank customizations XML file for this lab:
segment.target: The provisioning package should contain all of your customizations so we’ll create a blank customizations XML file for this lab:

segment.source: Congratulations!
segment.target: Congratulations!

segment.source: You've completed the Windows ICD portion of the lab.
segment.target: You've completed the Windows ICD portion of the lab.

segment.source: From here, you can learn more about classic Windows deployment techniques in Lab 2.
segment.target: From here, you can learn more about classic Windows deployment techniques in Lab 2.
